ingredients.name: Jalapeno
ingredients.taste: Jalapeno's vary widely in spiciness, but can be considered medium spiciness. Try some before adding them to the sauce
ingredients.use: Best used during the pan frying stage. Blending it raw will not make a good hot sauce

ingredients.name: Cayenne
ingredients.taste: Typically considered a medium-hot chili, as it is 12x hotter than jalapenos. Bit of zing to its flavor, and has health benefits.
ingredients.use: Best used during the pan frying stage. Blending it raw will not make a good hot sauce

ingredients.name: Ghost
ingredients.taste: 400x hotter than Tabasco sauce, Ghost Pepper Hot sauce packs a punch. It was the hottest chilli pepper before the invention of the Carolina Reaper in 2013.
ingredients.use: Best used during the pan frying stage. Blending it raw will not make a good hot sauce

ingredients.name: Water
ingredients.use: Use it during the pan frying stage to avoid burning the peppers. Use it during blending if you want a milder hot sauce.

ingredients.name: Vinegar
ingredients.taste: Adds a tangy, sour, lip-smacking flavor. Core ingredient for almost all hot sauce.
ingredients.misc: Benefits: Adds acidity to sauce, allowing it to have a much longer shelf life. It keeps the sauce from oxidizing.
ingredients.use: Must use ingredient during either pan cooking and blending process.

ingredients.name: Onion
ingredients.taste: Taste depends on the type of onion, so pick up ones at the store to match your preferences. Can be hot, bitter, sweet, acidic, so choose one you like or experiment!
ingredients.use: Use chopped onions during the pan stage to bring out the flavor of the onion and to incorporate it into the peppers.
ingredients.misc: Advice: Doesn't matter what kind of onion you use, but white and yellow onions will preserve the color of the hot sauce, while red onions might change it.

ingredients.name: Sugar
ingredients.use: Use it to give your hot sauce a sweeter taste. It can also give it a thicker texture.
ingredients.misc: Advice: Be aware that sugar will add calories to your sauce, but hot sauce calorie values are normally ignorable.

ingredients.name: Salt
ingredients.taste: Essential flavor in food and hot sauce. Infentifies aromas, balances flavors, and preserves food.
ingredients.use: Use anytime. You can never go wrong with salt, unless you add too much of course.
ingredients.misc: Advice: Be wary of the sodium content of your hot sauce if you add too much.

ingredients.name: Apple Cider
ingredients.taste: little sweet with much stronger smell and distinct flavor
ingredients.use: Use it during either the pan or blending stage. Add to bottle if you want pure cider in it.
ingredients.misc: Advice: Can subsitute for vinegar, but it all comes down to taste. Try both and choose one to use, or use a little of each.

ingredients.name: Garlic
ingredients.taste: Nutty, mild taste. Essential ingredient in many foods, and can boost flavors in hot sauce
ingredients.use: Cook it during pan stage to mellow out the flavors.
ingredients.misc: Advice: Be sure to not cook it for too long as it can burn quickly if cut small.
